Definition: Black fungus, also known as wood ear mushrooms or auricularia polytricha, is a type of edible fungus commonly used in Asian cuisine. It has a distinctive black color, and a slightly rubbery texture. Black fungus is often added to soups, stir-fries, and salads for its unique texture and flavor. It is believed to have various health benefits, including improving circulation, boosting the immune system, and promoting healthy skin.
